results.title: Wendy
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Wendy has her pregnancy terminated by abortion and the film reveals some of her reactions, her boyfriend’s and those of her mother to this situation. The film concludes with Wendy emphasising the importance of communications in teenage relationships. Cinemaphotography by Dean Semler. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Jenny
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
A film focusing on a teenage girl in a homosexual relationship. Jenny discusses her perception of the ‘gay’ scene, her relationship and how she feels other people perceive her life-style.

results.title: Brad
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Brad identifies himself as a homosexual. The film examines his reactions to homosexuality and the importance of relationships with other males. His mother expresses her feelings about Brad’s sexuality; he is shown in his employment and enjoying himself socially.

results.title: ACMI in the regions: Stories from East Gippsland
results.creator_credit: David Withers, Csilla Csongvay and ACMI
results.brief_description: The towns of Swifts Creek, Omeo, Lakes Entrance, Orbost, Marlo and Cape Conran are quite distinct from each other but all make up the region of East Gippsland, which lies in the south-east of Victoria. In ‘ACMI in the regions: stories from East Gippsland’, locals from each town are interviewed about their lives, their community and what makes living in these towns so special.
results.title_for_label: ACMI in the regions: Stories from East Gippsland

results.title: Turn on the TV in your head
results.creator_credit: Pawel Kuczynski, Study Sources Unlimited and H G Simons Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reading planet”.
Prism, a young alien from the planet Reading, is sent to earth to help five students improve their reading skills. With magical powers he transports them to outer space where he teaches them the importance of concentration and the process of visualisation. With practice the students discover that words can activate the formation of mental pictures. Reading becomes fun when they “turn on the TV in their minds”.
results.title_for_label: Turn on the TV in your head
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pawel Kuczynski, Study Sources Unlimited and H G Simons Productions

results.title: Hope of the future: inferences in reading
results.creator_credit: Pawel Kuczynski, Study Sources Unlimited and H G Simons Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reading planet”.
Prism, a young alien from the planet Reading, is sent to Earth to help five students improve their reading skills. Queen Zoria wants to assign Prism to another planet. The only way he can stay with his Earth friends is to prove that these students understand implied relationships and can read between and beyond the words. In an intense confrontation with Queen Zoria, the students prove their ability to understand inferences. She is so impressed with their excellent comprehension that Prism is permitted to continue his task of developing good readers.

results.title: To play the King
results.creator_credit: Paul Seed, Ken Riddington and BBC
results.brief_description: Ian Richardson is chilling in his portrayal of the now Prime Minister, Francis Urquhart. Determined to keep his power intact, Urquhart is challenged by the new King; a man with liberal ideals which set him on a collision course with the Prime Minister. Although Urquhart upholds the principles of the monarchy, he does not respect the man and therefore plans to topple him from his throne. Aided by a beautiful and cunning political assistant and egged on by his scheming wife, Urquhart is determined to remain the man pulling the strings.

results.title: Time scrambler
results.creator_credit: Pawel Kuczynski, Henriette Simons, Landmark Films and H Simons
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reading planet”.
The Time Scrambler has locked five students into a lost time frame. Designed to teach students to use a time line and to recognise sequencing cues in the reading selections. Tells how Prism, an 11 year old alien/teacher instructs his earth students in time sequence when the students become confused about the sequence of events in a story.
